components.description:
A customs officer inspecting luggage. May be shown on signage at airports or other border crossings.

Not to be confused with the passport control emoji.
components.title: Customs

description:
A customs officer inspecting luggage. May be shown on signage at airports or other border crossings.

Not to be confused with the passport control emoji.
title: Customs

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Transport And Map Symbols -> Signage and other symbols

bn:00082596v: Consider in detail and subject to an analysis in order to discover essential features or meaning
To consider in detail and subject to an analysis in order to discover essential features or meaning.

bn:00090460v: To try to find, to look for, to search.
To try to locate an object (a file, a folder, a computer, a text).
To examine; to try; to put to the test.
Try to locate or discover, or try to establish the existence of

bn:00084848v: To examine or inspect something in order to determine its condition; to check out
Examine so as to determine accuracy, quality, or condition

bn:00060925n: A document issued by a country to a citizen allowing that person to travel abroad and re-enter the home country
Any document that allows entry or passage.
A gouvernment issued proof of identity, with which one is allowed to cross a nation's borders.
A passport is a travel document, usually issued by the government of a nation, that certifies the identity and nationality of its holder for the purpose of international travel.

bn:00032600n: Part of the body at the front of the head
The face is a central organ of sense and is also very central in the expression of emotion among humans and among numerous other species.
Faces are the central sense organ complexes, for those animals that have one, normally on the ventral surface of the head.
The front of the human head from the forehead to the chin and ear to ear
The front part of the head, featuring the eyes, nose, and mouth and the surrounding area.

bn:00008379n: A teller is an employee of a bank who deals directly with most customers.
An employee of a bank who receives and pays out money
A bank clerk who receives and pays out money.
A cashier is the name of person who handles the cash register at various locations.
Person in charge of the cash of a business or bank.
A person who receives and pays out money in a bank, a shop, etc.

bn:00070230n: A person who watches over and protects property, assets, or people
Person employed to protect property or people
A person who is employed to provide security for people or property.
One set to watch; a person who keeps guard, especially one who guards a building, or the streets of a city, by night.
A security officer is a person who is paid to protect property, assets, or people.

bn:03532506n: A customs officer is a law enforcement agent who enforces customs laws, on behalf of a government.
